meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Here's my review of Moving Out 2:

Alright, let's get this out of the way – I'm not exactly the most serious reviewer in town (I mean, have you seen my profile picture? It's a cat in a tutu). But hey, that's what makes life fun, right?

Moving Out 2 is like that one friend who always brings the party to your living room. It's got the same zany energy as its predecessor, but with more chaos, more puns, and more... well, you get it.

I mean, Slant Magazine called it "chaotic adaptability in the face of whatever weird mash-up of things that Moving Out 2 throws at you." And honestly? That's exactly what I'm talking about. The game's got a way of tossing so many wacky challenges your way (like, have you seen the level where you're dodging giant beach balls while trying to deliver pizzas?) that you never know what's coming next.

Of course, not everyone's going to love this game as much as I do (see: Push Square, who called it a "successful follow-up" but didn't exactly gush with excitement). But if you're the type of person who loves Overcooked or, say, playing silly games with friends on a Saturday afternoon, then Moving Out 2 is right up your alley.

Now, I know some of my fellow critics might say that this game doesn't exactly "reinvent the wheel" (GameSpew, I'm looking at you). But honestly? Sometimes it's nice to just have fun without thinking too hard about it. And that's exactly what Moving Out 2 lets you do – whether you're playing solo or with friends online.

So, if you're in the mood for something lighthearted and downright silly (and who isn't, right?), then give Moving Out 2 a shot. Just don't say I didn't warn you when your friends start quoting the game's dad jokes at every opportunity...
